Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestAussiesPerth
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Staff were exceptionally friendly and made me feel very welcome. Hotel is currently undergoing renovations (March 2012). Rooms in Paris can be small, however the room I had at L'Empire was large, very modern and ultra clean. Bed was fantastic. Beautiful new and spacious bathroom. Also, hotel is in great location, just round the corner from Rue de Rivoli and minutes from lots of restaurants and bars. Highly recommended and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a find . . .”
Reviews.Author: txboiler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for two nights at the L'Empire Paris after having spent three nights at Disneyland Paris (at the Disneyland Hotel there). This was a family trip doing both "The Mouse" stuff and some sightseeing. Most of the reviews were positive for this hotel prior to my booking it, but they didn't do it justice. We were in room 303 - "Rembrandt" - I think. It overlooked rue de L'Arbre Sec. Location - The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, a 5 minute walk to The Louvre Museum, 20 minute walk to the Seine River boats/tours. There are huge department stores 2 minutes away. There are wonderful, cute little boulangerie/patisseries ALL around the hotel (3 minutes in any direction), and there are several little restaurants / wine bars on rue de L'Arbre Sec. You want to get on the Metro, you say? 3 minutes one way towards the Louvre for one station or 4 minutes the other way for Les Halles (a major RER + Metro/subway station). The hotel is tucked back 30 yards or so on rue de L'Arbre Sec, so it's not easy to spot from Rue de Rivouli (sp?). Once you find it, though, you're hooked. Rooms - We had a "family room" with a jacuzzi spa. It had a king bed (very comfortable) and a pull-out double for our two children in another room. Each room had it's own TV. Very modern, and very, very spacious by French/European standards. The bathroom was also very large and spacious by European standards. Then entire "apartment" was decorated in a very modern style which we all liked. Huge, spacious closets as well. Staff - The staff all spoke very passable English. My French is far worse than their English. They all were extremely accommodating - from asking for an extra luggage rack / holder in the bedroom, to asking to take some coffee and tea back to the room after our breakfast the staff was warm and welcoming. Better than the treatment we received at Disney, if you can believe that. The staff was knowledgeable about both the local area and how to get to different places. I'm sure they would have called a taxi if we didn't want to walk. Fluent in English, so no worries there. Breakfast - Breakfast was included with our room package. I would suggest that if you book at this hotel you ante-up for the breakfast. It had both hot and cold components, including salmon. Very upscale in both the presentation and the service. The restaurant / bistro (?) people were as nice as they could be. If you don't want breakfast at L'Empire, there is a McDonalds about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. You'll still spend 10 Euros per person, and you'll have to walk to get it. Downside - 1.) I don't know if this hotel would be a good choice from the middle of July through the middle of September. Our room did not have air conditioning, but it did have ample heat. The "air conditioning" we had to use was opening the big windows overlooking the street below. Effective in mid-March, but I don't know how effective it would be in the heat of the summer. 2.) Hot water - the temperature of the water in the shower changed every 2 - 3 minutes, when I suspect there was toilets flushing in other parts of the hotel. Come on, man! You can fix this with a 3 Euro valve, such that the water isn't scalding one minute and freezing the next. The water pressure wasn't that great, either, since it took almost 25 minutes to fill the jacuzzi tub. Summary - I would most definitely stay here again. Close to everything. Wonderful staff (better than Disney in most respects). Good breakfast. I would even suggest "buying up" to stay here if you have the means.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every sense”
Reviews.Author: crisb7
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for a week, this was our fourth visit to Paris and was by far the best hotel with the best staff we have experienced so far in Paris. A large room with a king size bed, bathrobes and slippers, a spacious bathroom as well ....it doesn't get better, it was the perfect room to go back to after a full day of sight seeing. We booked a superior room with windows into the inner courtyard, the street is quiet with hardly no traffic. I cannot say enough about how fantastic the staff were, from all at reception to the gentleman in the hotel's cafe, all looked after us very well. Location is spot on too! walking distance to most tourist sites and surrounded by cafes and restaurants plus only a block away from Les Halles square where most of the metro lines connect and the train to Versailles. This hotel with it's great staff made our weeks stay in paris a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: Cc9fcb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights around last march 2011. Location is great very close to Louvre and Les Halls,room was clean but quite on the small side however the staff made up for that with a great service. Lots of nice restaurants and bars round.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenanic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room on the 2nd floor for 1 night. Our room was modern, well-appointed, a comfortable size with a large bathroom. The hotel is in an excellent location (close to the Louvre Museum). The staff were fabulous, going out of their way to ensure our stay was pleasant. My only disappointment was no tea and coffee making facilities. We had to check out the next day as the rates rocketed due to St Valentines Day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Savannah R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after staying at one of the worse hotels in Paris. I ran here and they welcomed me with open arms. I think the room I stayed in was 311 or 309, but it was very clean, quite and comfortable with modern amenities and a generous size with a bog bathroom. I really like the slanted ceiling, with beautiful courtyard views. The staff was very friendly and willing to help me with whatever needs I had. Located an extremely convenient location for tourist, the Louvre is right around the corner and St. Germain is a quick walk across the seine. Tons of restaurants and bars, all within walking distance. Breakfast was delicious, and the bar staff downstairs were very friendly. A bit pricey for amenities (water, etc) I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Modern, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: smartiq
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Deluxe room February 2012. There was construction outside so hotel's small entrance was obscured. Room had no view, faced inside nondescript courtyard, but had two large windows with sunshine and was quiet. Room was clean and large and comfortable. There was a long hallway IN the room so you could not hear hotel hallway noises. There was a fully-stocked minibar, robes, furry slippers, separate toilet room, but too small bath/shower room that had a tower-heating rack however. There was a large screen TV with ipod holder. Male front-desk staff and bellboys were very friendly, and made the stay pleasant. Breakfast included in the room price was of mixed review. The bread basket and freshly-squuezed juice choices were excellent. The eggs were green and inedible as was the cheese (old brie) on some days. But the mixed bread/croissant basket made up for this. The cappuccinos were terrible, so don;t bother ordering cappuccino here -- stick to the cafe au lait which was fine. There is no spa or terrace bar unless they mean the tables outside on the sidewalk in front of the construction. The hotel can find you a taxi for a 10 euro added fare, but it was so easy to find a cab on Rue de Rivoli around the corner, that there is no point. Hotel staff booked reservations for us where we wanted, but because this is Paris, it is always a good idea to have the hotel staff call and CONFIRM those reservations before going to dinner. We tipped well for their help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: MontereyMark
Reviews.Content: Spending 9 nights in any one hotel can be a test of nerves, but L'Empire made our stay in Paris totally enjoyable. To begin with the location is incomparable. Metres from the Louvre, Notre Dame and within walking distance of the best of Paris. The extra cost of this hotel was worth it to avoid the metro and lost time. Additionally, there are brilliant eateries in abundance in this area. It's foodie heaven. Galeries Lafayette and Printemps are about a 20 minute walk as is the Palais Garnier (Paris Opera). The staff at L'Empire were just wonderful. We were allowed early check in and late check out - handy having flown from Australia. The front of house team were warm and effecient while Sonia and the breakfast crew could not do enough to help you. This hotel isn't your lavish Parisian maisonette but rather an ultra modern boutique hotel with an amazing location. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat for the location and personalised service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: janice E
Reviews.Content: The very best position for visiting the three areas we wanted to spend time in. Two minutes from the Louvre, almost as close to the Pont de Neuf and the St. Germain very hip area. Short walk to the D'Orsay and a little further to the Marais district, great on Sundays. Room spotless (and I am very fussy), lovely linen and towels, great TV,free wifi, bathroom small and more like a 'wet room' but very modern and clean. Average size for city hotel. Service always attentive and polite. Hotel photos on website do not do it justice, it may have had a refurb? Tea/coffee facilities in room + a full length mirror would make this place perfect, and that is nit picking. I've stayed in worse 5* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marie B
Reviews.Content: Superb location close to Louvre. W stayed 2 nights and everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A unique romantic experience”
Reviews.Author: smoiro
Reviews.Content: The "So romantic" package from this hotel provides a unique atmosphere for you and your other half. The "Superior Rooms" are well decorated, modern and big. Safe underground parking spaces can be easily found nearby. With such a good experience I will likely try it again in my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during our honeymoon. It was very conveniently located near the Louvre and to a metro stop (down the street). The (standard) rooms are tiny, but we expected that. The service was hit or miss. Sometimes the person at the front desk was great, and other times - not so much. For example, when asking the concierge which restaurant he'd recommend, he replied with "they're all good" and walked away. Uh, okay. I don't know if I'd stay at this hotel again. The location is convenient, but as long as you're near a metro stop, any hotel is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friedly staff, surprisingly large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Panos T
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for a couple fo days on a business trip. The reservation was not made by me and did not expect something special. I was wrong. My room was large - especially by Paris standards - clean and well equipped (well, a coffee machine would have helped more). The staff was friendly, the location really great, the breakfast excellent and the wifi free. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2011”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie R
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris...We stayed at the L'Empire. Everyone was fantastic. The room was big, clean, ipod hook up (superior room). The breakfast was great. The location was excellent, close to the metro, shopping and just to walk around the other streets. We had a wonderful staff, Simon, Sonia, Stephan, Armon, Tiego, all were wonderful to talk to. Everyone spoke very good English. They were all very knowledgeable of the area restaurants and things to do. Will differently stay there and highly recommend this hotel for your Paris stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern clean well run Hotel with friendly young enthusiastic and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaH4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husbands birthday. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. The location is absolutely fantastic and well within walking distance of local attractions including the Eiffel tower and is only about 2 blocks from the Lourve, we didn't use a taxi/bus once! We opted for breakfast included and were very pleased with the selection of items on offer, it worked out very cost effective as it can be expensive to eat in Paris. The Hotel had a great Cocktail bar which had a happy hour 6-9 which was perfect to visit before we went out to eat for the evening, drinks worked out very reasonable and the bar staff were really nice and would happily make anything you asked for. There are numerous cafes and bars locally to choose from, all of the lovely especially the little wine bar across the street called Le Garde Robe. We have already said we will stay at this hotel again, we will take the children with us next time. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mrsd072
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned on other reviews the location is brilliant, perfect for walking all over the centre of Paris with many attractions very close by. The staff are also a positive, friendly and informative with very good English. It is very modern and clean. Now the not so good... We arrived off a very early morning flight and the reception staff kindly took our cases and asked us to come back at 2pm to check in properly. So we have a lovely morning in Paris and returned to the hotel to check in. They told us then that our room had a problem: water had leaked from the roof so they were going to check us in to another hotel, then we could go back to L'Empire the next night and we would be upgraded from Deluxe to a Suite. We were a bit let down but went to this other hotel that was nearby but by no means of the same standard. There was a dirty/dusty smell in it. However we stayed the night and returned to L'Empire the following afternoon. The suite was lovely clean, spacious and very modern. Having to move each night did mean that we couldn't lounge about the hotel room and we did feel that we didn't really get value for money. I have since heard that this is a common thing to be moved so maybe overbooking is practiced here??

Reviews.Title: “Great location - has it's pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Alexj44
Reviews.Content: Location is great very close to Louvre and Les Halls, many nice restaurants and bars in the vicinity. I stayed 3 nights, and during 2 of them the elevator was not working, my room was in the third floor, so after a lenghty walk i did not enjoy the three flights up the stairs. Room was clean and decorated with good taste. Staff was fairly friendly. I got a rate of about 100 euros per night and at that price was o.k. with what i got.

Reviews.Title: “great location with terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: KeithJ23
Reviews.Content: Lovely friendly staff with good English skills. The room is a good size anspd well serviced. I was disappointed with the hot breakfast range but the continental range is very good. Location is superb it being an easy walk to many tourist spots like the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Boulevard St Michel - where you really can sip your Napolean brandy! Good range of resturants close by and there's a little supermarket in the same street that's really convenient. Stay out of the mini bar because it's quite expensive. The staff really made our stay there a joy and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PandK2010
Reviews.Content: We loved the simple black and white decor in the bedroom and bathroom, plus the large Loewe television with dozens of stations including BBC. The breakfasts were much better than most continental hotels and the location, near the Louvre was great

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: We loved hotel L'empire!! It is in a very central location - walking distance to the louvre and with a central subway station (many connecting lines) 5 minutes away. It's a modern hotel with beautiful decor. Each room is given a name - we were in Mortier and loved it. The room was very large with comfortable beds, was cleaned to perfection, and had a very large bathroom. We were upgraded for free upon our arrival, which was a lovely surprise. The staff were extremely helpful and provided us with many tips (including how to get a lower fare metro pass, where to eat, how to get cheap tickets to disneyland etc). They even leave chocolate on your bed at night. The hotel can be a big challenging to find from the subway station, as Chatelet Les Halles (the major station nearby) is very big and has many exits. Once we found the hotel, though, we didn't have any problems. Great place, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Fantastic Rooms & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: E C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on a few business trips, always find the atmosphere comfortable. For the Bastille Day celebrations I returned to the L'Empire with my family. The hotel staff could not have been more gracious and welcoming. Our room, a family suite, was perfect. The location could not be more central. When visiting Paris Hotel L'Empire is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in great area.”
Reviews.Author: raddison
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed rooms. Nice bar downstairs. Night manager Thierry very helpful n speaks perfect English. Luxury and expensive but worth every penny. Had a great stay and in great area.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: MissShellly
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled!!! This hotel falls under the 'Prestige Hotels Of The World' banner. They quote in their advertisement "Unique. High range. Hotels. All over the world. Experience. The unforgettable." How this hotel managed to qualify as a 'Prestige Hotel Of The World' is beyond belief! Spent 3 nights in a Suite Room, at 399 Euro per night. Yes, great location, friendly staff (although a little slow), nice room to look at on the website but don't be fooled, its all smoke and mirrors. Poor nights sleep due to bad quality curtains that don't fully close or block out light. No good for children/babies. Noisy neighbourhood and poorly insulated against noise. 1 iron and ironing board to service the entire hotel. Requested the sole iron and ironing board on day 1 - no show. Day 2, after 2 phone calls, and 1 hour later it finally arrived after threatening to check out of hotel. On our last night we call up to order room service (7:30pm) to be told that room service is closed. I ask why and was then told due to problems with Chef. Absolutely ridiculous! Half the power points in the room do not work and house keeping is very tardy. Each day was a different standard. On one day we requested face towels which took 2 phone calls, 2 visits to our room by staff and 1 hour later they finally arrived. We have traveled all over the world and have stayed in a range of different hotels. We can honestly say that we would never return to L'Empire and will be telling all our friends. We do not expect the world, but for the price we are being charged we do expect this hotel to deliver on what they promise. Absolutely terrible experience! PLEASE take this into consideration, there are so many lovely hotels in Paris so do your homework. Just because this hotel is in a good location won't make your stay any nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but loud”
Reviews.Author: Johnlatte
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at the L'Empire. It is in a great location. A short walk to the Louvre and Pont De Nuef (Notre Dame). The staff is young, but very helpful and very friendly. The check-in area is small as is the breakfast area that doubles as the bar. We had a suite that had a seperate bedroom and we had plenty of room in each room. The couch transformed into a bed. It was not your typical pull out, but our kids slept comfortably. The room was cleaned very well every day. The bathroom was a bit odd, with a lighted jacuzzi tub and a shower that didn't work well. We had to take tub bath every day, but that wasn't a big deal. The two downers on this hotel is that there is some renovations going on next door. We never heard them, but there was construction debris and fences up right next door. The other problem is at night, the area is fairly active with bars and restaurants. There were people coming and going all hours of the nigth (our room was on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel). Also there is a scooter park right in front of the hotel, and scooters cranking up all the time. Other than the noise from the scooters and the partiers, the hotel is fine. Would stay there again, but would ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, very large rooms for a Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieLeeW
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've ever stayed in in Paris (3rd visit). The staff are friendly and speak English immediately to you and very well. Extremely helpful. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom large and clean. Buffet breakfast high quality.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Decent Place, But if You Want a Desk and Chair, Get It in Writing"”
Reviews.Author: GordonChicago
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the --umm-- lobby, it will be apparent you are not entering one of the grand old hotels of Europe, but rather a very different sort of creature. As you walk into a rather wide hallway, which is the lobby, you realize that in lieu of the front desk there is a pedestal upon which a laptop computer rests and behind which stands an earnest, friendly young staff ready to greet you and check you in. As you look around, you may be somewhat comforted to see another room to your left in which there is a bar and eating area, and another room to your right in which you see newspapers in several languages ready to view, along with a small but interesting selection of books available to you during your stay. If you are checked into Room 402 as we were, you will find yourself in a very small room with no chair and no desk and with barely enough space for two persons to move around without saying "excuse me" to one another. This may not be what you expected, so, since you got in writing that your reservation includes a chair and a desk -- you did do that, didn't you? -- you do succeed in getting moved to Room 202 for the rest of your stay. This room is much better. It is perhaps 50% larger and has a place to sit and a desk. There is much more good news here. The young multilingual staff are very helpful and friendly. Upon checking in we were given a list and map, created by L'Empire, of local restaurants which they recommended. We followed this for every dinner during our stay and it was a super, super guide to local cafes which is worth its weight in gold and which is providing our favorite memories of Paris. A buffet breakfast was included in our rate. This was more than adequate and was quite enjoyable every morning we were there. The hotel has a good, central location on the Right Bank near the Louvre and within walking distance of the Chatelet metro stop and the Seine River. The style of the hotel is very sleek, contemporary, and minimalist. Once one gets used to it, you can have a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location...shame about the size of the room.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_mrss_i
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong the L'Empire hotel is a nice hotel in a fabulous location. It was clean, air conditioned and superb shower facilities with plenty of strong hot water but we paid £200 per room per night and the reception area was bigger than the room we got. The room was no bigger than a postage stamp and the access to the window was blocked. All said about the size of the room, the staff were very friendly and the hotel is in a fabulous location, 2 blocks from the Louvre Museum and very very central.

Reviews.Title: “a completely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Randella22
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to france for her 70th birthday in May as her first trip to France and my 5th. I choose this hotel based on location, trip advisor reviews, and the fact that my mom has an electric wheelchair and we were in need of a first floor no stairs hotel. This hotel was truly amazing! Very very clean and chic, but user friendly and the staff went out of their way to accomadate any needs we may have had...they arranged taxi's, restaurants, tours, answered all questions, got answers when they didn't have them...it was perfect. The neighborhood was very cute and allotted many different restaurant choices. We were able to walk to many many attractions and did so most of the time. i highly reccomend this hotel and can't wait to return! My only negative would be that I had emailed them after we left the hotel to go down south that I had left a bottle of parfum in the room and has asked them if they had found it. I send 4 emails and never received a reply, although that was how we communicated prior to my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures don't lie! Fabulous place and great people”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler76
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at L'Empire for 3 nights and loved everything about it. The staff was incredibly helpful, polite, and accommodating. The morning breakfast was great and even when the dining room was full they set us up with food in the lounge area. Incredibly nice! Our room was lovely, the bathroom was large (especially for Paris standards) and very new. After long days of touring Paris, I loved coming back in the evening to the night turn down service with our blinds closed, chocolate on the pillow and sheets turned back. The bed was incredibly comfortable and had fabulous sheets! The location is unbeatable as we could walk to everything. I would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs to tidy up around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Neils22
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our base in early June 2011 for a 3 day visit to Paris. Its location is it best feature being situated very close to both the Pont Neuf and The Louvre. To me this is a hotel trying very much to be a boutique hotel but done on the cheap and is now starting to fray around the edges. Where you should have seen leather they used faux leather which is starting to peel, the red tops of the small reception pedastals for example. For the bar, white covered MDF, which again is starting to show signs of age. The reception/lobby area has a machine that pumps out sickly sweet smoke/essence, again missing the mark, not at all like the very nice subtle almond/spice smells of the Gramercy Park or W in New York for example. We were staying in a room in the basement (Superior) and the carpet in the hallway outside had a large stain on it, a vacume cleaner was an ever present article in the stair well during our entire stay. The room itself was a good size but again it was all starting to look very shabby, the wardrobe door had a couple of large chunks out of the front, the tiles in the bathroom had been poorly grouted and made you focus on these rather than the actually sizeable bathroom. This leads me onto the shower (always my first barometer of a decent hotel room!) it was one of those extensions off of the main mixer tap unit and looked pretty poor. However looks can and were decieving and the shower was really powerful which leads me onto the next issue. The shower screen was woeful and could not contain the volume of water, the first time my wife used it we had a serious flood in the bathroom, a 2 inch deep puddle across the whole floor. The staff were quick to supply us with a mountain of towels to mop up the mess but this is a problem that could and should be avoided. The bed was huge and comfortable with clean bedding but the pillows were like sleeping on 2 blocks of concrete, really hard uncomfortable foam. We phoned down but the guy was unhelpful and we spent the first night using the supplied bath robes as pillows, again pretty unacceptable. The next day 2 new softer pillows turned up but again these were pretty poor in quality. Also our toiletries were not refreshed during the whole duration, i think that had run out of the "Bulgari" toiletries as when i asked the maid i was left with a rather blank expression, lucky then that the store room was left open and i could wander in and replenish the shower gel and shampoo with another product. One thing that cannot be faulted was the breakfast included in the price of the room, lots of choice, fresh and very tasty. To summarise this hotel is in the perfect location, some aspects of it were good and the staff tried hard but it is needs to tidy up as it is missing the mark for what it is trying to be.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable, relaxing holiday.”
Reviews.Author: gobi44
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in L'Empire and were impressed by the friendly staff and the lovely hotel. The hotel is immaculately clean, the room small with an ensuite but was not at all cramped. What a comfortable bed and the surrounding area is so quiet. There is little or no noise in the hotel and the staff are so lovely! Wine and beverages in the hotel are expensive but that is a given in Paris and L'Empire's prices were definitely not any more expensive than other places. It is so central and is in walking distance of the Louvre and is in the middle of great shops. It is very near the Marais (10 minute walk) which is also a very happening place. Choose your restaurants wisely some of the Brasseries on corners can fire out rubbish cuisine at an expensive rate. A lovely restaurant around the corner from the hotel is absolutely fantastic...real French Cuisine and so reasonable the name of the restaurant escapes me but the telephone number is 0033142219240 we had to book as it is obviously very popular. It is around the corner from L'Arbre De Sec the street our hotel was on. I would definitely stay in L'Empire again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased !!”
Reviews.Author: Montreal246
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my wife's birthday in Paris and chose this boutique hotel because of the high ratings on Trip Advisor. If you want to be close to the Louvre (1 block away) in an unusally large room (for Paris standards) with a beautiful bathroom, comfortable bed in a very nicely appointed room, this is the place for you. The staff are very helpful and a lovely breakfast was included. The only very small negative was hearing some hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPhyllis
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris. Stayed at this hotel and could not recommend it more highly. Found it on a search on the internet and it was a lucky and terrific find. Staff was as good as could ever be expected. Helpful in every way. I half expected the snooty attitude you often hear about the French and nothing could be farther from the truth with these people and I mean every member of the staff. The rooms were exactly as advertised. We had a suite and two deluxe rooms. They were spacious and the ammenities were great. I was told to expect small rooms in Paris. Not true. The location was wonderful. We are walkers and the location being as close to the Louvre as you could want and mid-way between Notre Dame and the Arch was perfect. Stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel-THE BEST Location”
Reviews.Author: KateMio
Reviews.Content: If your planning to stay in this hotel, I would very much recommend it. We were there for a week and it was lovely. It was my second visit to Paris and although we were planning a hotel somewhere around the Opera/Place Vendome or similar, we are very happy for staying in L'Empire. The location of this hotel is just perfect. You go outside the hotel and the Louvre Rivoli metro station is just across the street, and the most of the sightseeings are in the walking distance. We were in Paris beginning of January, it wasn't cold at all, so we were walking a lot. Also, you have plenty of restorants, cafes...even if you're really tired you can go out for a quick meal or snack. Back to L'Empire. The Staff was great. They all speak English, very very friendly. The room was for a superior room maybe small, but nice, very clean-but not impeccable clean, the sheets were changed ever day, so nothing to complain about that too. The breakfast is around 25 euros per person, and wouldn't recommend it for every day because it's little boring. I hope this helps. Kate

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly helpful service would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. Fantastic location about 5 mins walk from the Louvre & 10 from Champs Elysee. Very warm greeting with English speaking staff who did not make you feel unwelcome when you could not speak French (a very rare experience in Paris I must say). Room was nicely decorated, clean & spacious. Nice touches with slippers & fold down service. Very clean and comfortable. There is motion detector lighting in the common areas so when you step out of lift or your room it is pitch black and travelling alone I did not like that. Water would sometimes go cold intermittently in shower which was not great and there was construction work going on in the hotel very early with no note under the door advising this so that was a bit poor. Not cheap but based on location, service and comfort of facilities I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Margo2711
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just off the Rue De Rivoli a little further down from the Louvre, so an excellent base from which to explore Paris. Hotel is modern with trendy decor. Our room was a classic room - which was a decent size with good amenities. Great flat screen TV on the wall opposite the bed, with English channels!! Our only criticism of the room is that it was very cold. Also as it was downstairs you do hear some noise from staff, however my husband didn't hear the noise, only I did as I am a light sleeper. The breakfast offered a good selection with newspapers to browse through as you ate. All in all I thought the hotel offered good value for money with new, modern decor, espcially considering its central location. Would definitely recommend for a short hop to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be trusted”
Reviews.Author: Stayer20
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights in a Classic room. The second night we had one of these rooms and it was fine. However, when we arrived, we were shown to a room in the basement which they said was our room. Surprisingly, there was someone else's luggage in the room which they quickly removed. The room turned out to be noisy - staff nearby, drains, water pipes, rain overflow dripping on sill just outside the window, lift noise - so sleep was interrupted. And it was smelly - after the windows had been closed for a while we realised it smelled of old cigarettes. Clearly, the people who had been in the room had complained and they had been given our room, hence the luggage. When I confronted the hotel, they pretended that as the room was a bit bigger, it was an upgrade. As if they didn't know what their rooms are like! So, book here at your peril. You may get the nice room you booked or you may get put in a grim fifth rate room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Easily found & in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Travellor2009
Reviews.Content: PRos: Nice hotel, staff are friendly at the reception desk and they speak ENGLISH! The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Musee du Lourve (would not reccomend because its contents are so-so and its over priced and the ques are ridiculous), Royal Palais, 15 minutes to Musee du'Orsay (reccomend) and a 20 minute walk to Notre Dame (highly reccomend - free). Room is definately clean and spacious. They have included little extra luxuaries like bath robes and slippers too. The bed is big and comfortable. Bathrooms clean with what I call a 'heater hanger' that clings to the wall. You can hang your washing or wet towels on it and it will dry. Cons: Although the reception area is small and cute, it is hard to tell that that is the reception area because there is no desk. Its just 2 red block or columns standing next to each other where the receptionist stands to take calls etc. A bit bizarre. The free internet is located next to the reception desk on an old laptop resting on a woobly table. Make sure you do not ask the receptionist to send postcards off because 4 of my postcards never made it to their destinations. Overall a decent hotel in the heart of the city. Price? Not the best but alright.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Soft Bed”
Reviews.Author: morganhug
Reviews.Content: We were greeted immediately upon arrival and told that not only was our room ready, but we'd been upgraded to a suite! I'm used to tiny hotel rooms in Paris and this suite was BIG, even by Texas standards! The bed was very comfortable and an extra bonus were all the British TV channels. After being in France for a week, having something other than news in English was great. The breakfast was also a treat. The only downside was that our room was a couple of floors above the hotel bar, which is a very happening place. If you're looking for a quieter stay, I recommend asking for a room on the back side of the hotel. Overall it was a fantastic hotel. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Dundascouple_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at L'Empire Paris very much. We were greeted with a warmwelcome and given useful information. We were pleasantly surprised when we got upgraded. The room was spacious , modern , quiet and comfortable. We were close to the Louvre and Tuillerie Gardens and close to the metro. I would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect position”
Reviews.Author: silviabacca
Reviews.Content: We've been in Paris for 5 days, mid of July. L'Empire was perfect, impressive room and spacious bathroom, warm welcome, very professional staff. Great breakfast! Perfect position in the city, just 1 minute from Louvre Museum and everything is within walking distance: great choice of restaurants, bars and brasserie nearby. The hotel is in Rue de L'arbre sec, that is just off Rue de Rivoli - for shopping addicted! In 5 days, we decided to visit by foot the districts Pigalle, Montmartre, Opèra, Latin, Saint Germaine, Champs Elysees. Very helpful staff in planning trips, suggesting restaurants and bars. In summary, I absolutely reccomend L'Empire, and I will surely return next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: nroth
Reviews.Content: Apart from a staff not very friendly, the rooms are spacious (quite a surprise in Paris), the bed was very large (another suprise in Paris). Very good location for both tourist and business activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MariaD052
Reviews.Content: Well, we stayed with L'empire for 7 nights. Hotel is clean, friendly, private. Only cons: had to call 3 times before got the iron. Had to call twice to have the manager come up to my room and open the deposit box i managed to lock without having the code. Rooms are very small, but VERY VERY small. No room almost for anything. No table, no space at all for moving. But considering the fact that al rooms in Paris hotels are small... Breakfast is good but not changing at all. Same things over and over. No coffee amenities in room. Overall - good location, good hotel. free internet,

Reviews.Title: “We never made it past the front door...”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: We made the booking for this hotel through Booking.com but at arrival a VERY unfriendly clerk told us the hotel was full, denied the reservation and basically told us in French to shut up and leave. I refused, showed the reservation and under the intense attention of a large group of tourists had a verbal fight. Finally the clerk made a call and told us that we could have a room in another Paris hotel - some 10 minutes away. I refused to accept the offer and walk with luggage to an unknown hotel so finally he ordered a taxi. The hotel we went to was called LUMEN and they gave us the smallest room on earth on the fifth floor. On the wall was an enormous red painting (see picture) that shell shocked me but when I demanded another room there was none available. A small discount was given - but we will never stay there again... But publicity for both hotel EMOIRE as well as hotel LUMEN.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paul&Anne
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 50m off Rivoli down a quiet side street, 200m from The Louvre. The hotel was refurbished c2007 in a smart modernist style. Very helpful reception staff. We paid extra for a Superior room and were upgraded to a De Luxe. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Reasonable continental and English breakfast at the hotel. If you book a taxi at Reception, remember that the meter starts when the taxi picks up the call - it cost us 9 euros before we set off - but hailing a cab isn't easy either. We'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good price + good location!”
Reviews.Author: Gonzo033
Reviews.Content: We were there in december 09. The room was very comfortable, the stuff frindly. So we like that! Great location! We enjoy our trip to Paris. We come back, very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay, not a 4 star hotel, loud and rude Hotel Manager”
Reviews.Author: bkoh
Reviews.Content: Ive been to various hotels in Paris and around the world and this was by far one of the worst hotels that i have ever stayed at. 1. The hotel was extremely loud and I sholdve listened to the other reviews that complained about this part of the hotel 2. The Hotel manager wasnt considerate and didnt try to fix the problems during our stay 3. The shower broke the 2nd day and it didnt work for 2 days until they mvoed us into a better room 4. They didnt have a american converter so i had to go out and buy one 5. They had only 2 irons in the hotel so i couldnt iron my clothes for my business meetings 6. the hotel driver was 25 minutes late in picking us up and refused to take us to get fod since he wanted to get back to the hotel I would not recommend this hotel at all and im certain that you will be dissappointed. my trip was ruined and i wish i wouldve taken the advice and reviews from others that complained about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: moulin67
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying in boutique hotels, due to the consistency of quality that is normally associated with them. However, this hotel did not live up to the normal expectations of service, cleanliness and style. We stayed in the room nearest to the bar and the "front desk" and we could hear a lot of the bar and lobby noise in our room. The room had a strange sewerage type of smell that lasted our entire 3-night stay. I live in a city, and am used to odd smells, but it was so odd, we had to leave the door to the room open, to get some fresh air. When we checked into our room, the sheets had stains on them, and the comforter had a chocolate smudge on it. It was too late when we arrived to request new bedding for the night, so we just dealt with it. I requested new bedding the next morning and the situation was resolved. Overall the staff was rather unpleasant and the hotel was not very inviting. Service should not be replaced with empty style and attitude. This hotel tried to be stylish, yet somehow it missed the mark. I would not recommend this hotel for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: polonius
Reviews.Content: Don't have time to write a detailled review, but this is my second stay here and will definitely stay again. It's small, elegant, quiet, excellent location, beautiful rooms, very nice breakfast, very low key. The deluxe rooms are enormous, particularly by Paris standards (most of my friends in Paris don't live in flats this large), but even the standard rooms are quite spacious. Would definitely be a great place for a romantic getaway, but also very close to many tourist spots. Only negative compared to large hotels is of course it doesn't have the facilities such a business centre, fitness centre, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler91
Reviews.Content: The location was terrific. Great restaurants on the block with a great bakery just around the corner. We checked into one room but found that the window did not open. We asked if we could change rooms and while we were out the next day, everything was taken care of and the second room was fantastic... even had a view of the Eiffel Tower! The staff was exceptionally helpful and very courteous. The only downside is that there was a bit of street noise a couple of the nights - I think there was a bar down the street so we did hear people yelling on occassion. You may want to ask for an interior room if possible (BUT, won't have the view). So it's a toss up. Nothing ear plugs can't resolve. But definitely a great hotel - would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the first district.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: cindygh
Reviews.Content: The L'Empire was very modern and very clean. Free Internet was great. Location was good, but a little difficult to find at first. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a funny bad odor in the hallway each evening, but never in the room. The breakfast was supposed to be free, which they stated was not part of the room rate, but when we showed them the confirmation they agreed to give it to us both mornings. The breakfast was very good, but If we had to pay the asking price, I think it would have been overpriced. Over all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and comfortable - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: krone_9
Reviews.Content: Location Perfect - some nice restaurants nearby and close to the Louvre Room Large size, very nicely decorated. Comfortable bed, reasonable minibar with filtered water on tap. Free wifi was a definite bonus. View into a small courtyard was nothing to speak of but not unpleasant either. Bathroom was very nice - the deepest bath I've ever had! Absolute luxury.. Minibar was outrageously expensive (€5.50 for a can of coke) Breakfast Very nice quality breakfast - standard american vs european selection but with a few nice local touches. Lovely basket of pastries also provided. Amenities We wanted to hire a conference room but they were all booked up so the hotel gave us their reception room which sufficed (at no charge). We were told we could hire a projector but that the cost would be €150 which seemed a little excessive. They also needed a days notice to arrange it. Staff Very helpful, friendly and polite especially the evening staff. All were kind enough to speak english to us Negative points Not really any to speak of - the only minor one was there seemed to be a strong smell of sewage in the morning in the corridors to the rooms. This wasn't noticeable at all downstairs or in the rooms themselves. Summary Great hotel at very reasonable price compared to the competition. Recommend it for leisure travel certainly but also for business (just book your conference room etc in advance - dont' do it when you get there)

Reviews.Title: “Pricey boutique hotel worth at least one stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jannerbloke
Reviews.Content: Just off Rue St Honore not far from the river and at the Marais end of the North Bank this neat little hotel is well presented. We went with two teenage boys, only eat breakfast, didn't need internet or other facilities and really enjoyed the simple smart convenience. done it twice now and have since found somewhere in Rue des Beaux Arts on South bank we prefer but L'Empire is worth a go especially if it is a first visit to paris or you want a romantic hideaway. No noise problems but we have each time had a room overlooking an inside courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Busymum19
Reviews.Content: As I used trip advisor to help me choose our hotel I am very happy to share our experience with other travellers who may be thinking of booking this hotel - one word - DO. We booked an Executive suite which we shared with our two children. Upon arrival at our room we were greated with a complimentary tray consisting of champagne, soft drinks for the children, chocolates and fresh macaroons. We stayed for 5 nights and every night either sweeties or chocolates were left on our pillow. We had complimentary bath robes and slippers. The room was spotlessly clean - no sign of dirty curtains as previously discussed in another review. There was a problem with the bath tap but the staff could not do enough to help and even though it was a Friday evening took steps to locate a plumber. As the plumber could not come until the following day we were offered a different room on the first floor. I must admit that room was much smaller and cramped than our suite and I would not have traded places. There is some noise outside at night but that is only to be expected as the hotel is situate just off the main road Rue de Rivoli. There are street cafes around and cafe life is such in Paris that you have to expect some noise. We felt that this was a minor price to pay though for the excellent location. There is a fabulous patisserie just around the corner which is not to be missed. Breakfast at the hotel is good but it does get a bit boring after the 2nd day as it is the same thing every morning - or so it would seem. All in all, we had a fabulous time and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy - not as good as expected.”
Reviews.Author: Seymourgroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nightsat this hotel at the end of August for our 10th wedding anniversary and although the hotel could not be located in a better position we were disappointed by some aspects. When we arrived we were immediately told that we had been upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise. We were reminded no less than 3 times that we had been upgraded and once again when shown in to the suite. The bedroom was pleasant but lounge area very crampt with almost no daylight. Although we were on the "first floor " I could have jumped out of the window and risked no injury. This was indeed the biggest problem - too close to the road and VERY noisy. We were woken on a Saturday morning at 5.30 am by dustmen right under our window. The next night was noisy with partygoers until around 3am and then woken again at around 6.30am by more deliveries and banging. Avoid the front of the hotel - with no double glazing this will always be a problem - we may have just have left the window open! Bathroom was pleasant but not luxurious - and shower gel not replaced on day 2. Net curtains in bedroom were in serious need of a wash as were parts of the bathroom and windows. The staff were very polite and welcoming and breakfast was a pleasant experience although again nothing outstanding. On departure I insisted that we visited a deluxe room which is what we had booked and I'm convinced we would have been better off - it was at the back of the hotel, light and airy and of similar size to our "suite". All in all I feel we were downgraded not upgraded. The hotel needs to up its standards or it will get lost amongst many other quality properties in Paris. Certainly not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Speklova
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Paris at least once a year to visit friends. We always try different hotels as we haven't found one we want to return to, until now. L'Empire is brilliant! It's beautiful and stylish, staff is friendly and the location is perfect, 2 steps from Rue de Rivoli and walking distance from everywhere. The room was really big with a stylish decor and very large and comfortable bed! We are both quite tall and often find French beds a bit too short for us. Despite the central location the room was very quiet. Bathroom was big too, but noticed some flaws in the design, there's very little space around the sinks (we had double sinks in ours) to put your toiletries on, no hooks for the towels or robes and no shower curtain or proper cubicle, just a tiny little glass wall in the end of the bath which basically meant it was very difficult to shower without flooding the entire bathroom. Breakfast was nice but very expensive, so I would recommend going to a cafe nearby if all you want is a coffee and croissant. I will definitely be staying in L'Empire again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pinkymuldoon
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a spur of the moment weekend break in Paris. I found L'Empire through hotels.com and I'm so glad I did. The hotel is in the most perfect location for anyone wanting to see the sights in Paris and wanting to be in the heart of the hustle bustle, which we did. The Louvre is literally a stones throw up the road, the Seine is about 5 minutes walk, if that, and the hotel is tucked away just off the main road but surrounded by lovely little restaurants, bars and cafes. The metro is just accross the road for anyone wanting to go farther afield, but we found it very easy to walk everywhere and to use one of the boats on the river to go up to spots like the Eiffel tower. The boats are very reasonable and a much nicer way to see Paris than going underground via the metro! When we arrived at the hotel, the staff were very friendly and upgraded our room straight away. Having read lots of stories about how small rooms in Paris are, we were very surprised. Our room was really lovely with lots of space, a huge window looking down to the street below, and a huge bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and large. The hotel provides dressing gowns and slippers, leaves sweets on your pillow when you go out and has a well stocked and reasonable mini bar. There is a cafe downstairs that looks very trendy although we didn't get a chance to use it. They also offer facilites such as in room massage, although again, we didn't have enough time to use this! There is an excellent room service menu and the room was immaculately clean. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. The one thing that was a bit of a shame but not the hotels fault, was that it was quite noisy at night and in the early hours of the morning when the rubbish van came, but the noise certainly wasn't all night and I would expect this staying in such a central location. It wouldn't put me off staying there again at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GarzaNLD
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. It is a four star service. Rooms are small, but it is to be expected in all Paris Hotels. Rooms are CLEAN, very important in Paris since most hotels rooms are old. This hotel is very new since it was just recently renovated. Location is good, the Louvre is two blocks from the hotel and pretty much everything is within minutes from this location, at least the important monuments and locations. Cityrama is within 5 to 10 minutes from this hotel which is also good if you are going to plan tours with them. Price is also good just a few bucks more from a 3 star and believe me 3 stars in Paris is two stars in the US. This hotel is a four star, I do not know why trip advisor has it as three star. I will recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well located but costly”
Reviews.Author: LaJollaJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Empire in Paris in the middle of August. This small hotel is located just blocks from the Louvre and the Louvre/Rivoli Metro station. Included in our package was an excellent breakfast served every morning in the first floor cafe. The suite was spacious and well decorated, and large for Parisian standards. It was air conditioned and quiet. The bathroom was very nice, though our sink had a crack and the shower head was difficult to use. In addition, housekeeping did not consistently replenish the toiletries as we'd hoped. The weakest aspect of the hotel was its concierge service or lack thereof. I would like to have had someone assist us in planning our stay, booking reservations and generally making life easier when dealing with the language barrier; Overall, I would still recommend the hotel, as it accommodated my husband and I, along with our two sons quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at L'Empire for the first time this week and would highly recommend it as a centrally located, clean, friendly and personable hotel in Paris. I booked a superior room but was upgraded to a suite upon arrival. The staff were very attentive both upon check in and in the breakfast room the following day. It has that small hotel charm whilst not being too pokey/too b&b'ish. The room was large (very large by Paris standards) and I had a look at a superior as well while it was being made up which was similar in size (though didn't have a separate lounge). You can't beat the location - close to Louvre, walk to Champs Elyesees, Cityrama bus terminal etc. The neighbourhood is lovely with fashion boutiques and cafes/restaurants all around. I have stayed at a number of hotels in Paris and wouldn't hesitate to stay at L'Empire again. Only bad point is it doesn't have a fitness centre so I had to go for a run around the Tuilleries (garden in front of Louvre which is only a few mins away - but then again, who can complain about that?)

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience, good value”
Reviews.Author: 1mayday1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at L 'Empire the week of 06/08 for business reasons. It's very centrally located a block from the Louvre. All aspects of service including front desk, concierge, cleaning, and restaurant were great. The room was stylish, clean, and very quiet. A colleague of mine had trouble with his tv and they provided an upgraded room. All in all a very good experience and would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LoveParis40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect in location. It is a block from the Louvre museum and easy access to the L 'open tour bus ( hop on and hop off). Great shops and cafe's close to hotel. The staff are really firendly and excellent customer service. I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel Just Down the Street from the Lourve”
Reviews.Author: dawgdave4
Reviews.Content: Super friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are nicely sized for any city, so I suppose they're huge for Paris. Location is perfect -- a few hundred yards from the city's largest train station (into which almost all train lines run) and just down the street from the Lourve. Breakfast, though not included in the room rate, is excellent as well. If you're looking for a hotel in the right bank, you cannot ask for more than L'Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Found a gem!”
Reviews.Author: trvllr1
Reviews.Content: We we're heading to Paris for a 3 night stay and stumbled across L'Empire. Pleasantly surprised! Lovely modern, design hotel feel, great location, walk to the Louvre, the Seine. Nice sized room, very clean, although had an unpleasant odour from the bathroom. Breakfast room nice and staff extremely friendly. The concerns about the credit card also happened t myself, although I asked the staff upon check-in and was advised that the money would be released on my credit card upon my check-out. It happened the next day, so it was no issue. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service & GREAT Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbaloo120
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel very tired from our overnight flight from the US around 9:00 AM. Knowing check-in wasn't until 2:00 PM, we expected to wander Paris until we could get settled in. The day was very cold and rainy and the front desk clerk recognized we were exhausted. He was able to get our room ready by 10:00 AM. He made us very comfortable in the lobby and when our room was ready, they had already taken our baggage and had the room completely ready for us to relax. Later that night, the nighttime front desk clerk realized we were hungry (Almost midnight). We didn't have our bearings yet and he personally escorted us to the nearest sandwich shop and convenience store for a midnight snack. The front desk staff helped us find our way everywhere we wanted to go giving us tips and great directions. They were able to speak English and guided us using maps and detailed directions. We were provided umbrellas when it was raining and we were always greeted with a smile when we returned. The staff made us feel right at home. This hotel is very centrally located, a block from the Louvre, metro station, and other historic sites. We walked everywhere because of the location. My wife and I were weary to stay in a smaller boutique hotel, but the experience here could not be beat. We have stayed in a number of 5 star hotels in the US but this small hotel put them all to shame. The room size was just fine and very clean. Turndown service is provided and the chocolates were wonderful. If you are staying for more than a day or two, unpack to make more room. A safe is provided in the room and free Wi-Fi was easily accessible and fast. The bathroom was spacious and the bed very comfortable. We stayed on the third floor with an interior room overlooking a courtyard. There was construction next door, but we had no problem noise. We decided not to eat at the small restaurant; it was pricey and had a limited selection. We were able to find many other local bakeries’ close by for coffee and pastries for a lot less. The next time we are in Paris we'd definitely stay here again. Thank you L'Emipre Hotel for making our trip even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and superb service”
Reviews.Author: JuulesTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Paris is for us a 3-hour drive, so we came by car :) to Paris. Upon arrival at the hotel they asked the car key and parked our car in a private parking, took our luggage to the room and in no-time we were ready for the city. The entree and reception lookes modern and with nice and friendly staff. The room (suite 'Ney') could be some bigger but it was very clean and surely lookes like a 4 star hotelroom suppose to look. The bed was very nice and comfortable (not to hard, not to soft) so we had a good night sleep. The hotel is located near Rue de Rivoli with many nice (payable) shops and a bigger metro station (Chatelet) so we were able to travel by metro very fast through Paris. The cafe 'Le Fumior' is nearby Le Louvre and nearby the hotel, we went there for a little snack and a degistif at night. It's a jazz modern grand cafe with beautiful Parisien and good sized menu (6 rue de l'amiral Coligny). The day we left we checked out in the early morning and had a final walk trough the city, we left the luggage in the hotel and when we came back to get out luggage and the car, they allready took care of it and parked our car -with luggage already in the car- outfront. It's just how service should be: good, simple and with a smile. Later on this year we will go back to Paris and stay in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: jo553
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely boutique hotel from 2nd - 5th January. We had a superior room on the 3rd floor, which included an excellent breakfast in our tariff. The room was comfortable, very spacious and clean with lovely fittings, and nice bathroom with dressing gowns and slippers. The whole place was spotless, and every member of staff we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. Its not often that I can say I truly would recommend a hotel, but I do with this one.( And there is usually something to find fault with, but not with this hotel) It is in a lovely part of Paris and very convenient for the Louvre, metro and batobus. I have read reviews on this site and others, and some people have complained about the noise from the street experienced in rooms on the lower floors, so do request a high floor. We heard no noise at all. When next we go to Paris I wont look for anywhere else to stay but the Hotel L'empire.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Authorization over £1000 taken from my account.”
Reviews.Author: MickBarrs
Reviews.Content: Bad experience for 3 reasons. 1. The room we were given was in the basement next to the cleaners room so we were woken up at 6 o'clock in the morning. 2. The room was freezing cold because the heater was not working. What made this worse was the fact that the staff and management were aware that the heating was not working and in December when its below zero its not acceptable. 3. I pre-paid £200 for my room months ago so i should have not paid anything on my room. I got home to find they had taken a pre-authorization amount of £1008.71. If i had not checked my internet banking i would have not realised they had taken this money. Overall a poor hotel, over priced, cold and a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings - not sure I will be back again”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveler31
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel before as I love the location, but I left with mixed feelings this time on the room, service and facilities: - The king size bed is actually two twin beds next to each other (and you can feel the gap). Not as comformatble as the full bed. - The hotel is seriously understaffed. I arrived at 3:00 PM to check-in, and had to wait another half hour for the room to be ready. I also asked for a chair to e brought in, and never received one despite 3 calls to reception. Their answer was: "we don't have enough staff". - facilities: very basic. It does has that "Bed & Breakfast" feel, but with a much higher cost! Bottom line is: I probably won't be back again. There is lots of choice in Paris and I think you can get a lot better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: razor1966
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day break in Paris to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is in a great location practically right next to The Louvre and 5 mins walk to Pont Neuf. We found the hotel staff very courteous and our room was very clean with an extremely comfortable bed. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but problems with payment”
Reviews.Author: Lars010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week-end and loved the room and the breakfast. However as other travellers have mentioned the hotel took a €800 deposit on our credit card upon arrival for the 3 nights stay (room rate + €50 per day in possible other expenses.) When we wanted to check out they wanted the credit card again so they could charge it with €650 for the room. I then asked them to cancel the deposit first so that i didnt have to pay 800 +650. The were not able to cancel the deposit so we ended up with discussing this with them for some time. The promised us that if we pay the €650 they would cancel the deposit within a few days. So be BEWARE ot the deposit they require and remember to ask them to cancel it before they charge you again. Very good that some other reviews mentioned this also. They promised to call us but we have not heard anything yet. Probably better to pay cash at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “authorisation against my debit card”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleJulie
Reviews.Content: I also had problem's with the hotel. They had held the total cost of staying at the hotel plus 50 euros a day for extras, just in case we used any against my debit card. When I came to pay the bill, I had no money in my account. Luckily, my friend paid the entire bill. The authorisation would stay against my card for 1 month, leaving me with no money in my account. I couldn't find any information about this in their website. I have never experienced this before and it left a very unpleasant feeling about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ptdublin
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay in this hotel. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The room was really nice and comfortable. The location is great, within easy reach of the metro, shopping and many attractions. Breakfast was also very good. I would highly recommend it to all

Reviews.Title: “L'Empire is Superb”
Reviews.Author: JayBee102
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed a the L'Empire Hotel for one night when we were in Paris (July 22, 2008). It is a superior boutique hotel. The staff was excellent and our overall experience was fantastic. Safe at night; okay to walk around the neighborhood. I have stayed in Paris several times in hotels from much less expensive to very expensive. This rivals the finest hotels in Paris. Our two-room suite was huge by Paris standards; there were two flatscreen tvs (bedroom and living room). When we checked in, I was concerned about possible street noise (the hotel is just off rue Rivoli) but it wasn't a problem. We enjoyed the pure luxury of the place and slept soundly. The living room had a queen size fold-out sofa that was quite comfortable. No metal bars under a thin mattress, no mustiness, no bad smells, no run-down carpets. The hotel elevator is big enough for people and luggage. The surrounding neighborhood is fantastic both day and night, filled with a variety of cafes and quite good restaurants, including less expensive Chinese and Lebanese take-out places and a small grocery store. It is within short walking distance to The Louvre and is close to two Metro stations (Louvre-Rivoli and Chatelet). It is 2-3 blocks from Forum des Halles (the famous shopping mall), the Gardens of Les Halles, and St. Eustach (the Grand Church of Les Halles). L'Empire is a stylish place with a lot of class and would be spectacular for a honeymoon or anniversary; it was a real splurge for our family but we were only in Paris two days and one night so we went all out. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this property without hesitation. If you wish to stay in a hotel that is as memorable as the city itself, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here - would definalty stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jbn01
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel was brilliant. The location was great, the room was great but the service we received topped it all off. The staff were more than helpful. The bar next door was great, when we first went in they gave us 2 drinks for the price of 1 and were constantly bringing out plates of food. Overall this hotel made our stay in Paris a great one and I would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and well located for tourists”
Reviews.Author: HK79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at L'Empire Paris in the beautiful Paris summer 2008. The property is an above average modern 4 star hotel in a truely excellent location for seeing the most important landmarks (less than 5 minutes walk to the Louve and less than 15 minutes walk to St Germin). I stayed in a superior room (480 euros per night). The room faced an internal courtyard, was larger than normal with an extra large bathroom (deep bath tub). The room was bright and quiet with modern decor. The hotel staff were friendly and helped out when asked (restaurant recommendations/ bookings, maps, tours etc.) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: SarahDarren
Reviews.Content: Hi My husband booked a night away in Paris the day before departure and selected this hotel via the Eurostar website. We have mixed reviews because the hotel left very little impression on us. This hotel is situated in the heart of Paris centre so the location as previoulsy mentioned is great. We didn't have to walk too far to visit many of the top attractions, and there are bistro/restaurants all around the hotel. It's located on a side street off the main Rue Rivoli and near Rue Honore. The positives were the friendly staff and the room size was great (we were on the top floor in a deluxe room). However to be honest I was glad to get out because the overall impression was that it was cold, dark, slightly clinical and theres not really a vibe about it. The floorings are all hard, walls are either painted white, grey or black with a few splashes of red and the check in desk is just two columns. It's neither contemporary or funky and I think it will look very dated very quickly. I normally love modern boutique hotels but this just didn't fit the bill. The stairwell (the lift only goes to the 5th floor) was like one out of a hospital with awful flooring and dodgy paintwork. It really spoilt the entrance to our room. We didn't stay to eat breakfast, we went out to eat at a local restaurant. We very nearly walked out to stay somewhere else but as we were only there one night we couldn't be bothered. In response to previous points regarding the sitting room with fireplace, it is now open next to the entrance. It's neither cormfortable or warm and has white/grey walls with just 4 small leather tub chairs and two tables, with a modern fireplace which wasn't on. The blinds are black and were closed. Anyway enough doom & gloom. We wouldn't stay again, we love boutique hotels but prefer luxurious furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: GemmaO
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just got back from Paris and really enjoyed our stay at L'Empire hotel. We had a lovely big room with wooden flooring, a huge king size bed which was very comfortable (apart from the pillows were a bit hard), big LCD TV, very big bathroom with 2 sinks and the shower was extremely powerful. Fabulous location a 2 minute walk from the Louvre and the Metro, you couldn't ask for a more central location. The only slight down side is that because the hotel is so central you may find that when you go to sleep you can still hear a bit of noise, but it really didn't effect us at all, so don't let that put you off staying at this hotel. I certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep, No Service”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Jo2003
Reviews.Content: Well on arriving at the hotel we were upgraded to a suite, which was very nice. I can't fault the rooms and the location, particularly the little cafe on the corner nearby which did amazing lunch, traditional French things. But.........on returning from dinner at 12pm we found a party going on in the block of flats next door to the hotel, our upgraded room was only two windows away and the noise was unbelievable. Being tolerant Brits we didn't mind despite it being extremely loud, thinking it might end at 2am, unfortunately by 2.30am it was getting worse. I went down to complain only to find other people down there already complaining. The hotel staff said there was nothing they could do, the police had come and not been able to find the party. I suggested they ring them again and I could lean out of the window and show them were it was ! The hotel wouldn;t call the police again and insisted the hotel was full and we couldn;t be moved. The party went on until 5.30am and we could not sleep at all. Once we finally slept we woke up at 12noon the next day and therefore missed out on our morning in Paris (we were only there for one night). Despite this the hotel insisted we paid the full €300 room rate. Insisting we had to email the manager on our return to the UK. We did but surprise surprise the email bounced, and the hotel will not return our repeated emails. Do not stay at this cráphole. It might have been an isolated incidence but no effort was made to accomodate us elsewhere or to find us an alternative hotel. For a couple on a rare night away from a young baby this was not exactly what we wanted from a night in Paris. Awful, simply awful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel - will be hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: ejhBristol
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a get location, close to the louvre. The rooms exceeded our expectations. Not sure if we were upgraded but the room was really big for Europe, double sinks in the bathroom etc. Everything is really modern, fresh and clean. The staff couldn't do enough for us, were really friendly and helpful. We went to Moulin Rouge which I would really recommend, the show is fantastic and well worth the money. Best to book direct as you pay a premium for the hotel to book, but at least it is hassle free. My only complaint would be that the walls are pretty thin. A couple in the next room were having a huge row at 2am one night and the walls felt paper thin. No noise the following night after they had moved out so I'm not sure if they were just exceptionally bad and would have been heard word for word anywhere! Overall fantastic and I will stay again if I return to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel (if its style is your bag)”
Reviews.Author: anon73
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Feb of 07 - the hotel had just opened (or so it seemed). There weren't even numbers on the doors or a sign in the front. We were there for a quick weekend getaway, and very much enjoyed the privacy and quiet that the hotel provided - it seemed we were the only ones there...which was at least partially true. We'd never stayed in the 1st arr before - it's OK but we prefer the other bank. The hotel is what they call a "minimalist" style - no table in the room, so breakfast was literally in bed, really no other furniture other than a very large and comfortable bed and plasma screen TV with no English channels. No lobby to speak of, which is OK by us though. Certainly NOT a traditional Parisian hotel with silk wall coverings and Louis XV furniture. Very modern, very hip - not our bag though. Great for a quiet stay though. NOTE: As I said, when we stayed there it seemed the hotel was only open for a week or two - things may have changed.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Uglybug_Dave
Reviews.Content: After a good search on the Internet we quickly realized that good hotel rooms in Paris are both rare and relatively expensive. The occasion was our 25th Wedding Anniversary and I wanted to make the most of our two nights in Paris. We took EuroStar to Paris Gard Du Nord followed by a 10 minute taxi ride to the Hotel. Don't expect the taxi drivers to know where your hotel is located. Fortunately, we printed out a map of the location, which was just as well because the hotel entrance is not very prominent. The hotel is modern and clean. We found the staff very welcoming and friendly. We were also told that our reservation had been upgraded to a Suite. Very nice!! The accommodation was excellent; large bathroom with shower, the sitting area had the mini bar, wardrobes, sofa bed and it's own plasma TV and the large bedroom also had it's own plasma TV. Of the 1045 TV channels available, only 4 are in English (but we didn't come to Paris to watch TV!!) The hotel does not have it's own restaurant or bar, however it's location in Le Louvre means that you are surrounded by many nice cafe's and restaurants. Everything was very comfortable and I would be happy to use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Content: Great Right Bank location ... five minute walk from the Louvre and the Seine, surrounded by great restaurants. Five mintues away from the Metro. Modern Luxury with comfortable beds and a helpful service. Knowing French was not necessary. The hotel was very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!! Worth every penny! The breakfast was great, too. Rooms included bathrobes, slippers and an evening turndown service leaving chocolates on your pillow. Loved it!

HotelInfo.Name: Empire Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 48 rue de l'Arbre Sec, 75001 Paris, France
